{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the relevant documents, there is evidence to suggest that Dickkopf-1 (DKK1) has a role in prostate cancer. Document [0] states that high serum levels of DKK1 are associated with a poor prognosis in prostate cancer patients. Document [2] shows that tumor suppressor ZBTB38 promotes DKK1 expression in prostate cancer cell lines, and reduction of DKK1 expression restores ZBTB38-mediated suppression of migration and proliferation of prostate cancer cells. Document [3] indicates that DKK2, a member of the DKK family, promotes proliferation and invasion via Wnt signaling in prostate cancer. Document [6] suggests that DKK1 can lead to immune evasion in metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.
